item.description:
Three things to remember for this workshop: 1) register and pay via www.maineadulted.org., 2) enter the high school via intersection of Route One and Municipal Dr next to brick town hall (NOT on Rt 144 side by fields), then through the high school parking lot and around it's right side to staff parking lot E, enering at side door C14 for this class. 3) Bring: notebook, opt camera, clothes that can get dirty, work boots & gloves; one trash bag of garden-building material of your choice (non-chemcially treated leaves, grass, seaweed, compost or newspapers).

Workshop description:Come as a beginner, or expand on MOFGA or pemaculture classes, putting knowledge into hands-on action! Create highly-productive, weed-free organic garden beds for annual and perennial food crops without the need for tilling or digging. Beds of any shape or size can be created almost anywhere, turning lawns into edible abundance!

Enjoy classroom time, engaged discussion, a slide show about the no-dig method, plenty of Q&A, then go "hands-on", creating one of these very garden beds outdoors in the high school courtyard.

Leave fully prepared to replicate these techniques at home with free or low-cost materials found in most neighborhoods. Ages 16 and up.

Registration: You can RSVP here but please confirm your registration and pay via the Scarborough Adult Ed web site:  http://scarborough.maineadulted.org/courses/course/food_not_lawns_nodig_raised_garden_beds

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Food Not Lawns: Weed-Free, No-Dig Garden Bed Building Workshop
